Variety Editions: U.S Latino Global Asia Subscribe Today! Navigation Menu Film TV Digital Contenders Video Dirt Scene More Biz Music Legit Jobs Conferences Insight Archives Directory Choose Edition: U.S Latino Global Asia Russia | My Account Sign In Subscribe Home Digital News YouTube Extremist-Video Ad Controversy Prompts GroupM to Team With Brand-Safety Analytics Partner Todd Spangler NY Digital Editor @xpangler Share This Article LinkedIn Email Print Talk Courtesy of GroupM March 29, 2017 | 08:00AM PT With advertisers around the world still reeling from the revelation that their ads appeared in hate-speech videos on YouTube, WPP’s GroupM is taking a new step to reassure clients that their ads won’t show up next to undesirable content on the Google-owned service. GroupM, the world’s biggest media-buying firm, on Wednesday announced a partnership with social-analytics provider OpenSlate to help advertisers analyze YouTube content for quality and brand safety. GroupM said the new solution with OpenSlate will initially roll out in the U.S. and U.K., with plans under way to expand to additional international markets. The company said Google is enabling its partnership with OpenSlate to identify content that’s not brand-safe. Currently, GroupM’s clients are the only advertisers able to monitor content in the Google Preferred program — which comprises the most popular YouTube channels in specific categories — in this way. Advertisers that have pulled ad spending from YouTube, and in some cases Google’s display advertising networks, include AT&T, Verizon, FX Networks, PepsiCo, Walmart, Dish Network, Starbucks, GM, JP Morgan Chase & Co., Johnson & Johnson and Lyft. That’s in addition to more than 250 U.K. advertisers who have frozen spending on YouTube, an exodus touched off by a report by the Times of London that ads from major brands were appearing in videos posted by white supremacists and other hatemongers. Related YouTube Hate-Speech Ad Fallout Continues: U.S. Advertising Trade Group Urges Google to Rectify ‘Crisis’ Some analysts expect the impact on Google’s bottom line to be minimal. But the company could lose up to $750 million in ad revenue from the controversy, according to an estimate released last week by Nomura’s Instinet. According to GroupM, under the deal with OpenSlate the analytics firm will provide clients of its agencies additional controls and content safeguards to support their YouTube media buys. The solution will span both reservation media, including Google Preferred, and in auction-based inventory bought through AdWords or DoubleClick Bid Manager. Using OpenSlate’s data, clients will be able to better define the type of content that should be excluded from their YouTube media buys, the companies said. In addition, OpenSlate will provide GroupM agency clients with reporting that details exactly where their campaigns have run. “Most brands today have scaled their advertising on digital platforms like YouTube, where most content is user-generated, but their needs for mature and safe ad products and environments persist,” Susan Schiekofer, chief digital investment officer at GroupM North America, said in a statement. GroupM’s Schiekofer conceded that it’s not possible to eliminate all risk for advertisers when it comes to user-generated media, but she positioned the partnership with OpenSlate as an extra step it is taking to ensure clients’ brand reputations. Together, GroupM and Kantar account for over half of WPP’s more than $20 billion in annual revenue. Google has publicly stated that it’s taking a number of steps to make sure ads are not placed against offensive content. The internet giant’s chief business officer, Philipp Schindler, wrote in a blog post last week that Google is improving the controls and reporting tools advertisers have about where their ads are displayed. He said the company also is hiring more staff and developing artificial-intelligence algorithms to better identify hate speech. That hasn’t mollified the concerns of some major advertisers. Last week Bob Liodice, CEO of the Association of National Advertisers, said Google and other digital advertising platforms must do more to make digital advertising absolutely safe for brands. “Brands choose those platforms to work hard for them to achieve all of their business and brand building objectives. But the most important of those priorities is ‘to do no harm,'” Liodice said. Filed Under: Google GroupM OpenSlate Youtube Want to read more articles like this one? SUBSCRIBE TO VARIETY TODAY. (DLR) Opus Bank (OPB) Receives Average Recommendation of “Hold” from Analysts March 29th, 2017 - 0 comments - Filed Under - by Stacy Sanders Filed Under: Consensus Rating Articles - Finance Tweet Shares of Opus Bank (NASDAQ:OPB) have earned an average rating of “Hold” from the nine ratings firms that are presently covering the company. One equities research analyst has rated the stock with a sell recommendation, six have issued a hold recommendation and one has issued a buy recommendation on the company. The average 1 year price target among brokers that have covered the stock in the last year is $32.33. Several brokerages have recently commented on OPB. Hovde Group increased their price objective on Opus Bank from $25.00 to $31.00 and gave the stock an “outperform” rating in a research note on Monday, December 19th. Zacks Investment Research downgraded Opus Bank from a “hold” rating to a “strong sell” rating in a research note on Saturday, January 7th. JPMorgan Chase & Co. downgraded Opus Bank from an “overweight” rating to a “neutral” rating in a research note on Monday, January 30th. Finally, TheStreet downgraded Opus Bank from a “c-” rating to a “d+” rating in a research note on Monday, February 6th. The Company provides banking products, services and solutions to its clients through its Retail Bank, Commercial Bank, Merchant Bank, and Correspondent Bank. The Company’s Commercial Bank consists Commercial Banking, Business Banking, Healthcare Banking, Technology Banking, Fiduciary Banking, Institutional Syndications and Commercial Real Estate Banking (CREB), which includes Income Property Banking, its Structured Finance Group and Capital Markets Group. (NFG) Barclays PLC (BCS) Rating Increased to Hold at Zacks Investment Research March 29th, 2017 - 0 comments - Filed Under - by Tyrone Williams Filed Under: Analyst Articles - US - Finance Tweet Barclays PLC (NYSE:BCS) was upgraded by Zacks Investment Research from a “strong sell” rating to a “hold” rating in a note issued to investors on Wednesday. According to Zacks, “Barclays' shares significantly outperformed the Zacks categorized Foreign Banks industry over the last six months. The company’s efforts to restructure and simplify its operations have started bearing results, leading to lower costs. Further, the company is on track to wind down its Non-Core division by mid-2017 (driven by continued divestiture of non-core operations world-wide). However, mounting regulatory and compliance costs as well as higher legal expenses continue to be major concerns. Also, the company has been facing pressure on revenues owing to weak global economic recovery and uncertainty related to Brexit.” Other research analysts have also recently issued reports about the company. BCS raised Barclays PLC from a “hold” rating to a “buy” rating in a report on Monday, January 9th. JPMorgan Chase & Co. reaffirmed a “neutral” rating on shares of Barclays PLC in a report on Tuesday, March 14th. Berenberg Bank reaffirmed a “sell” rating on shares of Barclays PLC in a report on Monday, January 30th. Deutsche Bank AG reaffirmed a “neutral” rating on shares of Barclays PLC in a report on Thursday, December 1st. Finally, Credit Suisse Group AG began coverage on Barclays PLC in a report on Tuesday, November 29th. They issued an “outperform” rating for the company. Four equities research analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, six have given a hold rating and eight have issued a buy rating to the stock. Barclays PLC presently has an average rating of “Hold” and an average price target of $31.47. Barclays PLC (NYSE:BCS) opened at 11.37 on Wednesday. The firm has a 50 day moving average of $11.35 and a 200 day moving average of $10.45. The firm has a market capitalization of $48.20 billion, a PE ratio of 22.38 and a beta of 1.18. Barclays PLC has a one year low of $6.76 and a one year high of $12.05. The business also recently announced a dividend, which will be paid on Wednesday, April 5th. Stockholders of record on Friday, March 3rd will be given a dividend of $0.097 per share. This is a positive change from Barclays PLC’s previous dividend of $0.05. The ex-dividend date is Wednesday, March 1st. Barclays PLC’s payout ratio is presently -29.41%. Financial News Asset Management Rankings shake-up for top 10 fund managers Franklin Templeton and Carmignac give ground to Nordea, Robeco, and Pictet in key annual survey of a €2.8 trillion industry Diana Mackay, joint chief executive of MackayWilliams Company Photograph By David Ricketts March 29, 2017 Updated: 2:36 p.m. GMT Asset management giants Franklin Templeton and Carmignac have fallen out of a list of Europe’s top 10 funds brands, overtaken by rivals deemed to have more innovative products. US-headquartered Franklin Templeton, which has struggled with outflows from its blockbuster Global Total Return and Global Bond funds, has fallen from fourth to 11th place in the annual rankings of fund management brands in Europe by market research firm Fund Buyer Focus. Paris-based Carmignac has dropped from ninth to 12th. The firm, the Berlin-based arm of consultancy MackayWilliams, specialises in telling fund managers how they are perceived among the advisers who buy or recommend mutual funds for retail clients.  Fund Buyer Focus interviewed 1,000 fund selectors that oversee €2.8 trillion of assets between them. Templeton and Carmignac were the only two asset managers to have dropped out of their top 10 list. According to Morningstar data, Templeton's Global Bond and Global Total Return funds – which have a bias towards emerging markets – together haemorrhaged total assets of $14.7 billion last year. Nordea, the biggest climber in this year's ranking, moved up 14 places to eighth. Robeco moved up four places, to 10th. Both appeared in the top 10 brands for the first time. The top three brands – BlackRock, JPMorgan and Fidelity – remained unchanged from last year. Pictet climbed from 10th position to fourth, joining Europe's elite top five brands for the first time. UK-listed asset manager Schroders rose one place to finish fifth, as did Invesco at sixth and Deutsche Asset Management at seventh. M&G was the only asset manager in the top 10 to slip, down four places to ninth. Diana Mackay, joint chief executive of MackayWilliams, said high scores for innovation and "client- oriented thinking" were common among all top 10 fund firms. She said despite Franklin losing its coveted top 10 spot, prospects for the US fund house are "on the turn". "Franklin shot through the stars with its bond products a few years ago but when that fell away others leapt over them in terms of innovation." "But they have launched a lot of products and our expectation is that the tide is turning.  We expect Franklin will be on the rise," she said. Franklin Templeton declined to comment but a spokesperson for the US manager pointed to comments made by chief executive Greg Johnson earlier this year, in which he said the impact of rising interest rates during the first quarter "was felt across geographies and sectors, and contributed to shifts in market leadership in a number of areas". Johnson said: "In this environment, improved performance across the board, particularly for our hybrid and global macro strategies, validates our sound, long-term investment approach and belief in the importance of active management." Mackay said the brand score of Carmignac, had slipped due to its "specialist approach", and a particularly heavy reliance on its flagship Patrimoine fund. She said that having a heavy reliance on blockbuster products can leave a fund brand vulnerable, particularly when selectors lose appetite for that investment approach. Morningstar data shows Carmignac's Patrimoine fund, which has almost $26bn in assets, saw outflows of $1.5 billion during 2016. "The problem for Camignac is that they invented this mixed asset product – they made it but there are now so many competitors. If their fund is slightly off the boil selectors will have plenty of other choice. People are waiting for them to come up with something that is different to the Patrimoine legacy," she said. Carmignac declined to comment. Mackay said that Pictet's rise to the top five was due to its "strong reputation for thematic funds," and said: "The other side of the coin is the mixed asset arena, where Nordea has shone through." Ben Seager-Scott, director of investment strategy at wealth management firm Tilney Bestinvest, said there had been a "noticeable pick-up in activity from Pictet and Nordea, particularly from a UK perspective". "I certainly get the impression that they're engaging with wealth managers and promoting their products at conferences and events more than they were," he said. Darius McDermott, managing director of Chelsea Financial Services, said Pictet's Robotics fund stood out as being particularly innovative. He also said Nordea's €18bn Stable Return fund has been popular among fund selectors. The product has been seen as a rival to Standard Life's Global Absolute Return Strategies – another blockbuster multi-asset vehicle. However, he acknowledged the tough landscape for asset managers to shine: "Asset management is extremely competitive. There are over 100 fund managers for us to look at," said McDermott. "Maintaining contact and relationships with fund buyers is critical for them and it is getting harder for them to achieve. They need to know the people who do the research and the funds they want," he said. Catalyst Multimedia Today's Paper Topics ePaper WealthCheck SEARCH Follow Home News Markets Companies Money & Banking Economy Info-tech Opinion Specials Portfolio BLink Stocks Forex Commodities Gold & Silver Today's Pick Portfolio Tracker European shares inch higher as Brexit divorce process to begin Reuters comments   ·   print   ·   T+  ·   T- Tweet London, March 29:   European shares edged higher on Wednesday as Britain was set to formally trigger divorce proceedings with the European Union it joined in 1973. The pan-European STOXX 600 index was 0.1 per cent higher by 1000 GMT, with modest gains driven by broker upgrades and results. Markets were muted as investors awaited details on the two parties' negotiating positions ahead of long and complex talks. “It's like a race: we are firing the starting gun and now we just have to see how it develops,” said Stephen Macklow-Smith, head of European equity strategy at JP Morgan Asset Management. “When you have a market that's more driven by macro than fundamentals it can be tricky, but the playbook is well rehearsed. Everyone has already positioned for this,” he said. Both Britain's FTSE 100 and the more domestically exposed mid caps were flat. “If the negotiations go well, domestic stocks could do a bit better,” said Macklow-Smith, noting their devaluation after investors shifted away from domestic exposure since the Brexit referendum last June. Separately, merger negotiations between London Stock Exchange and Deutsche Boerse were halted after EU antitrust regulators blocked the proposed deal, as expected, saying the merger's size would have harmed competition. LSE shares gained 1.8 per cent, while Deutsche Boerse was up 0.3 per cent. Autos stocks were the best sectoral gainers, rising 0.5 per cent. German carmaker Daimler drove gains after it said it expected record sales for its Mercedes-Benz cars for the first quarter. Automotive suppliers Faurecia and Valeo benefited from broker upgrades. Engie rose 2.9 per cent to its highest in more than four months, the top French and European gainer, after JP Morgan upgraded its view on the gas and electricity supplier to overweight. Top-ranked JPM analyst Vincent Ayral said Engie had reached an inflection point, with the dilutive effects of the company's transformation plan more than compensated by restructuring gains, supportive FX, and organic growth. 3I Group gained 3.2 percent after Morgan Stanley raised the private equity group to “overweight", saying the value proposition of Benelux-based discount retailer Action, an important part of 3I's portfolio, is not fully priced in to the shares. Norsk Hydro led basic resource stocks higher, up 2.7 per cent after ratings agency Moody's upgraded its baseline credit assessment of the aluminium producer to Baa2 from Baa3. German online classified ads firm Scout24 was the worst-performing European stock, down 7.1 per cent and set for its worst day in 3 1/2 months after it posted results and a 2017 outlook below consensus. “There seems to have been a good deal of introspection and reflection at Scout ... 2H16 may not be much better than 1H16, but 2017 will be intriguing,” say Jefferies analysts. Swedish bank SEB was down 5.3 per cent after going ex-dividend. (This article was published on March 29, 2017) Post Comment Related NEWS Sensex up 122 points on strong FII inflows; SBI, ICICI Bank top gainers TOPICS economy, business and finance | stocks and shares | Get more of your favourite news delivered to your inbox SEND MY NEWS Please enter your email. The firm currently has a “hold” rating on the stock. Scotiabank’s price objective points to a potential upside of 10.14% from the company’s previous close. A number of other equities research analysts also recently issued reports on MPC. Bank of America Corp set a $59.00 price objective on shares of Marathon Petroleum Corp and gave the stock a “buy” rating in a research note on Monday, November 28th. JPMorgan Chase & Co. upgraded shares of Marathon Petroleum Corp from a “neutral” rating to an “overweight” rating and increased their price objective for the stock from $46.00 to $57.00 in a research note on Wednesday, December 7th. Credit Suisse Group AG increased their price objective on shares of Marathon Petroleum Corp from $55.00 to $63.00 and gave the stock an “outperform” rating in a research note on Wednesday, January 4th. Jefferies Group LLC reduced their price objective on shares of Marathon Petroleum Corp from $62.00 to $61.00 and set a “buy” rating on the stock in a research note on Monday, January 23rd. Finally, Barclays PLC reduced their price objective on shares of Marathon Petroleum Corp from $68.00 to $62.00 and set an “overweight” rating on the stock in a research note on Thursday, February 2nd. Four investment analysts have rated the stock with a hold rating, nine have given a buy rating and three have assigned a strong buy rating to the stock. Marathon Petroleum Corp currently has an average rating of “Buy” and an average target price of $55.54. Shares of Marathon Petroleum Corp (NYSE:MPC) opened at 49.03 on Monday. The company has a market capitalization of $25.88 billion, a P/E ratio of 22.19 and a beta of 1.74. Marathon Petroleum Corp has a 1-year low of $32.02 and a 1-year high of $54.59. The company’s 50 day moving average is $50.11 and its 200-day moving average is $46.95. Marathon Petroleum Corp (NYSE:MPC) last announced its quarterly earnings data on Wednesday, February 1st. The company reported $0.43 earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, topping analysts’ consensus estimates of $0.26 by $0.17. The firm had revenue of $17.28 billion for the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $14.54 billion. Marathon Petroleum Corp had a net margin of 1.85% and a return on equity of 5.74%. The business’s revenue for the quarter was up 10.2% on a year-over-year basis. During the same period in the prior year, the company posted $0.79 earnings per share. On average, equities research analysts forecast that Marathon Petroleum Corp will post $2.96 EPS for the current year. The business also recently declared a quarterly dividend, which was paid on Friday, March 10th. Stockholders of record on Thursday, February 16th were paid a $0.36 dividend. The ex-dividend date of this dividend was Tuesday, February 14th. This represents a $1.44 dividend on an annualized basis and a dividend yield of 2.94%. Marathon Petroleum Corp’s payout ratio is currently 65.16%. Marathon Petroleum Corp Company Profile Marathon Petroleum Corporation is engaged in refining, marketing, retail and transportation businesses in the United States and the largest east of the Mississippi. The Company operates through three segments: Refining & Marketing; Speedway; and Midstream. The Refining & Marketing segment refines crude oil and other feedstocks at the Company’s seven refineries in the Gulf Coast and Midwest regions of the United States. Two analysts have rated the stock with a hold rating and two have assigned a strong buy rating to the company. Brokerages have set a 12 month consensus price objective of $80.00 for the company and are anticipating that the company will post $1.04 earnings per share for the current quarter, according to Zacks. They noted that the move was a valuation call. Minerals Technologies (NYSE:MTX) opened at 75.90 on Wednesday. The company has a 50-day moving average of $76.32 and a 200-day moving average of $74.85. About Minerals Technologies Minerals Technologies Inc is a resource- and technology-based company that develops, produces and markets a range of specialty mineral, mineral-based and synthetic mineral products and supporting systems and services around the world. It operates through five segments. The Specialty Minerals produces and sells the synthetic mineral product precipitated calcium carbonate (PCC) and processed mineral product quicklime (lime). Upgrades United States Steel Co. (X) to “Strong-Buy” March 29th, 2017 - 0 comments - Filed Under - by Patrick Bannon Filed Under: Analyst Articles - US - Finance Tweet United States Steel Co. (NYSE:X) was upgraded by equities researchers at Vetr from a “buy” rating to a “strong-buy” rating in a research report issued on Monday. The brokerage presently has a $38.76 price objective on the stock. Vetr‘s price objective would indicate a potential upside of 16.85% from the stock’s current price. Several other research analysts have also recently commented on X. Argus cut United States Steel from a “buy” rating to a “hold” rating and reduced their target price for the stock from $33.78 to $6.15 in a research report on Tuesday, November 29th. Macquarie reaffirmed an “underperform” rating on shares of United States Steel in a research report on Wednesday, November 30th. JPMorgan Chase & Co. raised their target price on United States Steel from $29.00 to $37.00 and gave the stock an “overweight” rating in a research report on Wednesday, November 30th. Deutsche Bank AG raised their target price on United States Steel from $24.00 to $40.00 and gave the stock a “buy” rating in a research report on Monday, December 5th. Finally, Credit Suisse Group AG reaffirmed an “outperform” rating on shares of United States Steel in a research report on Wednesday, December 7th. Four investment analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, eight have issued a hold rating, seven have given a buy rating and one has issued a strong buy rating to the company’s stock. United States Steel has a consensus rating of “Hold” and a consensus price target of $32.30. United States Steel (NYSE:X) opened at 33.17 on Monday. The company’s market cap is $5.78 billion. United States Steel has a 12 month low of $12.77 and a 12 month high of $41.83. The company has a 50-day moving average of $36.87 and a 200-day moving average of $29.59. United States Steel (NYSE:X) last issued its earnings results on Tuesday, January 31st. The company reported $0.27 EPS for the quarter, topping the consensus estimate of $0.01 by $0.26. The firm earned $2.65 billion during the quarter, compared to analysts’ expectations of $2.65 billion. United States Steel had a negative return on equity of 11.36% and a negative net margin of 4.29%. United States Steel’s quarterly revenue was up 3.0% compared to the same quarter last year. During the same period last year, the business earned ($0.23) earnings per share. Analysts predict that United States Steel will post $2.74 EPS for the current year. The firm also recently announced a quarterly dividend, which was paid on Friday, March 10th. Stockholders of record on Friday, February 10th were paid a $0.05 dividend. The ex-dividend date was Wednesday, February 8th. This represents a $0.20 dividend on an annualized basis and a dividend yield of 0.60%. United States Steel’s dividend payout ratio (DPR) is presently -6.83%. COPYRIGHT VIOLATION WARNING: “Vetr Inc. Upgrades United States Steel Co. (X) to “Strong-Buy”” was first posted by Daily Political and is the property of of Daily Political. Hedge funds have recently made changes to their positions in the stock. Mitsubishi UFJ Securities Holdings Co. Ltd. purchased a new stake in shares of United States Steel during the third quarter worth approximately $103,000. TLP Group LLC purchased a new stake in shares of United States Steel during the third quarter worth approximately $186,000. Cheyne Capital Management UK LLP purchased a new stake in shares of United States Steel during the third quarter worth approximately $189,000. Tyers Asset Management LLC purchased a new stake in shares of United States Steel during the fourth quarter worth approximately $196,000. Finally, LS Investment Advisors LLC raised its stake in shares of United States Steel by 24.2% in the third quarter. LS Investment Advisors LLC now owns 10,911 shares of the company’s stock worth $206,000 after buying an additional 2,124 shares during the last quarter. Institutional investors own 77.18% of the company’s stock. United States Steel Company Profile United States Steel Corporation is an integrated steel producer. The Company is engaged in producing flat-rolled and tubular products with production operations in North America and Europe. The Company operates through three segments: Flat-Rolled Products (Flat-Rolled), U. S. Steel Europe (USSE) and Tubular Products (Tubular). To view Vetr’s full report, visit Vetr’s official website. (HES) PT Set at $52.00 by Scotiabank March 29th, 2017 - 0 comments - Filed Under - by Tyrone Williams Filed Under: Analyst Articles - US - Finance Tweet Hess Corp. (NYSE:HES) received a $52.00 target price from analysts at Scotiabank in a report issued on Monday. The brokerage currently has a “buy” rating on the stock. Scotiabank’s target price points to a potential upside of 9.59% from the company’s previous close. A number of other analysts also recently issued reports on the stock. Evercore ISI downgraded shares of Hess Corp. to a “buy” rating in a report on Friday, March 3rd. Goldman Sachs Group Inc downgraded shares of Hess Corp. from a “conviction-buy” rating to a “buy” rating in a report on Wednesday, March 1st. KLR Group reiterated a “buy” rating and issued a $72.00 price objective (up from $68.00) on shares of Hess Corp. in a report on Thursday, January 26th. Finally, JPMorgan Chase & Co. upgraded shares of Hess Corp. from a “neutral” rating to an “overweight” rating and lifted their price objective for the company from $58.00 to $65.00 in a report on Thursday, December 8th. Eight equities research analysts have rated the stock with a hold rating and nine have assigned a buy rating to the company’s stock. Hess Corp. has a consensus rating of “Buy” and an average target price of $63.97. Hess Corp. (NYSE:HES) opened at 47.45 on Monday. The firm’s market capitalization is $15.02 billion. The company’s 50-day moving average is $49.93 and its 200 day moving average is $53.30. Hess Corp. has a 1-year low of $45.12 and a 1-year high of $65.56. Hess Corp. (NYSE:HES) last posted its quarterly earnings data on Wednesday, January 25th. The company reported ($1.01) earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, beating the Zacks’ consensus estimate of ($1.08) by $0.07. Hess Corp. had a negative net margin of 126.59% and a negative return on equity of 7.51%. The company had revenue of $1.39 billion for the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $1.23 billion. During the same period last year, the company earned ($1.40) earnings per share. The firm’s revenue was down .1% compared to the same quarter last year. On average, equities analysts expect that Hess Corp. will post ($3.03) EPS for the current fiscal year. The company also recently announced a quarterly dividend, which will be paid on Friday, March 31st. Investors of record on Wednesday, March 15th will be paid a $0.25 dividend. The ex-dividend date of this dividend is Monday, March 13th. This represents a $1.00 annualized dividend and a dividend yield of 2.11%. Hess Corp.’s dividend payout ratio is presently -5.06%. Hess Corp. Company Profile Hess Corporation is an exploration and production company. The Company is engaged in exploration, development, production, transportation, purchase and sale of crude oil, natural gas liquids (NGL) and natural gas. The Company’s segments include Exploration and Production, and Bakken Midstream. Its Exploration and Production segment explores for, develops, produces, purchases and sells crude oil, NGLs and natural gas with production operations primarily in the United States, Denmark, Equatorial Guinea, the Malaysia/Thailand Joint Development Area (JDA), Malaysia and Norway. (AAPL) Price Target to $165.00 March 29th, 2017 - 0 comments - Filed Under - by Latisha Jones Filed Under: Analyst Articles - US - Finance Tweet Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) had its price objective raised by Instinet from $135.00 to $165.00 in a report released on Friday morning. Instinet currently has a buy rating on the iPhone maker’s stock. A number of other equities research analysts also recently issued reports on AAPL. Robert W. Baird restated an outperform rating and issued a $133.00 target price on shares of Apple in a report on Tuesday, January 24th. Drexel Hamilton restated a buy rating and issued a $185.00 target price on shares of Apple in a report on Thursday, December 8th. Vetr upgraded shares of Apple from a buy rating to a strong-buy rating and set a $133.51 target price for the company in a report on Tuesday, January 10th. JPMorgan Chase & Co. restated an overweight rating on shares of Apple in a report on Tuesday, January 24th. Finally, Stifel Nicolaus restated a reduce rating and issued a $115.00 target price on shares of Apple in a report on Monday, January 23rd. Two equities research analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, nine have issued a hold rating, forty have issued a buy rating and one has issued a strong buy rating to the stock. The stock has an average rating of Buy and an average target price of $240.62. Shares of Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) opened at 143.80 on Friday. The stock has a 50 day moving average of $137.90 and a 200-day moving average of $120.93. Apple has a one year low of $89.47 and a one year high of $144.04. The firm has a market capitalization of $754.45 billion, a price-to-earnings ratio of 17.26 and a beta of 1.26. Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) last posted its quarterly earnings data on Tuesday, January 31st. The iPhone maker reported $3.36 earnings per share for the quarter, beating analysts’ consensus estimates of $3.22 by $0.14. The business earned $78.35 billion during the quarter, compared to analyst estimates of $77.37 billion. Apple had a net margin of 20.73% and a return on equity of 34.94%. The company’s revenue was up 3.3% on a year-over-year basis. During the same quarter in the previous year, the business posted $3.28 earnings per share. On average, equities analysts anticipate that Apple will post $8.94 earnings per share for the current fiscal year. About Apple Apple Inc (Apple) designs, manufactures and markets mobile communication and media devices, personal computers, and portable digital music players, and a variety of related software, services, peripherals, networking solutions, and third-party digital content and applications. The Company’s products and services include iPhone, iPad, Mac, iPod, Apple TV, a portfolio of consumer and professional software applications, the iOS and OS X operating systems, iCloud, and a variety of accessory, service and support offerings. X Edition: United States Business Business Home Legal Deals Aerospace & Defense Finance Autos Reuters Summits ADventures Data Dive Markets Markets Home U.S. Markets European Markets Asian Markets Global Market Data Stocks Bonds Currencies Commodities Futures Funds Earnings Dividends World World Home U.S. Special Reports Reuters Investigates Euro Zone Middle East China Japan Mexico Brazil Africa Russia India Politics Politics Home Polling Explorer Live: Trump's First 100 Days Supreme Court Tech Technology Home Science Top 100 Global Innovators Media Environment Innovation Commentary Commentary Home Podcasts Breakingviews Breakingviews Home Breakingviews Video Money Money Home Retirement Lipper Awards Analyst Research Stock Screener Fund Screener Life Health Sports Arts Entertainment Oddly Enough Pictures Pictures Home The Wider Image Photographers Focus 360 Video European shares inch higher as Brexit divorce process to begin Africa América Latina عربي Argentina Brasil Canada 中国 Deutschland España France India Italia 日本 México РОССИЯ United Kingdom United States Market News | Wed Mar 29, 2017 | 5:24am EDT European shares inch higher as Brexit divorce process to begin * STOXX 600 up 0.1 pct * Gains muted as investors await Brexit details * Engie tops CAC 40; JPM analyst says 'at inflection point' * 3I up as Morgan Stanley praises Action value proposition * Autos stocks drive gains * EU antitrust regulators block LSE-Deutsche Boerse merger (ADVISORY- Follow European and UK stock markets in real time on the Reuters Live Markets blog on Eikon - see cpurl://apps.cp./cms/?pageId=livemarkets) By Helen Reid LONDON, March 29 European shares edged higher on Wednesday as Britain was set to formally trigger divorce proceedings with the European Union it joined in 1973. The pan-European STOXX 600 index was 0.1 percent higher by 1000 GMT, with modest gains driven by broker upgrades and results. Markets were muted as investors awaited details on the two parties' negotiating positions ahead of long and complex talks. "It's like a race: we are firing the starting gun and now we just have to see how it develops," said Stephen Macklow-Smith, head of European equity strategy at JP Morgan Asset Management. "When you have a market that's more driven by macro than fundamentals it can be tricky, but the playbook is well rehearsed. Everyone has already positioned for this," he said. Both Britain's FTSE 100 and the more domestically exposed mid caps were flat. "If the negotiations go well, domestic stocks could do a bit better," said Macklow-Smith, noting their devaluation after investors shifted away from domestic exposure since the Brexit referendum last June. Separately, merger negotiations between London Stock Exchange and Deutsche Boerse were halted after EU antitrust regulators blocked the proposed deal, as expected, saying the merger's size would have harmed competition. LSE shares gained 1.8 percent, while Deutsche Boerse was up 0.3 percent. Autos stocks were the best sectoral gainers, rising 0.5 percent. German carmaker Daimler drove gains after it said it expected record sales for its Mercedes-Benz cars for the first quarter. Automotive suppliers Faurecia and Valeo benefited from broker upgrades. Engie rose 2.9 percent to its highest in more than four months, the top French and European gainer, after JP Morgan upgraded its view on the gas and electricity supplier to overweight. Top-ranked JPM analyst Vincent Ayral said Engie had reached an inflection point, with the dilutive effects of the company's transformation plan more than compensated by restructuring gains, supportive FX, and organic growth. 3I Group gained 3.2 percent after Morgan Stanley raised the private equity group to "overweight", saying the value proposition of Benelux-based discount retailer Action, an important part of 3I's portfolio, is not fully priced in to the shares. Norsk Hydro led basic resource stocks higher, up 2.7 percent after ratings agency Moody's upgraded its baseline credit assessment of the aluminium producer to Baa2 from Baa3. German online classified ads firm Scout24 was the worst-performing European stock, down 7.1 percent and set for its worst day in 3 1/2 months after it posted results and a 2017 outlook below consensus. "There seems to have been a good deal of introspection and reflection at Scout ... 2H16 may not be much better than 1H16, but 2017 will be intriguing," say Jefferies analysts. Swedish bank SEB was down 5.3 percent after going ex-dividend. (Reporting by Helen Reid; Editing by Kit Rees and Alison Williams) Next In Market News Britain does not expect 50 bln stg Brexit bill-Davis LONDON, March 30 Brexit minister David Davis said he did not expect Britain to have to pay 50 billion pounds ($62 billion) to the European Union as part of the Brexit process and said the era of huge sums being paid to Brussels was coming to an end. The pan-European STOXX 600 index was 0.1 percent higher by 1000 GMT, with modest gains driven by broker upgrades and results. Markets were muted as investors awaited details on the two parties' negotiating positions ahead of long and complex talks. "It's like a race: we are firing the starting gun and now we just have to see how it develops," said Stephen Macklow-Smith, head of European equity strategy at JP Morgan Asset Management. "When you have a market that's more driven by macro than fundamentals it can be tricky, but the playbook is well rehearsed. Everyone has already positioned for this," he said. Both Britain's FTSE 100 and the more domestically exposed mid caps were flat. "If the negotiations go well, domestic stocks could do a bit better," said Macklow-Smith, noting their devaluation after investors shifted away from domestic exposure since the Brexit referendum last June. Separately, merger negotiations between London Stock Exchange and Deutsche Boerse were halted after EU antitrust regulators blocked the proposed deal, as expected, saying the merger's size would have harmed competition. LSE shares gained 1.8 percent, while Deutsche Boerse was up 0.3 percent. Autos stocks were the best sectoral gainers, rising 0.5 percent. German carmaker Daimler drove gains after it said it expected record sales for its Mercedes-Benz cars for the first quarter. Automotive suppliers Faurecia and Valeo benefited from broker upgrades. Engie rose 2.9 percent to its highest in more than four months, the top French and European gainer, after JP Morgan upgraded its view on the gas and electricity supplier to overweight. Top-ranked JPM analyst Vincent Ayral said Engie had reached an inflection point, with the dilutive effects of the company's transformation plan more than compensated by restructuring gains, supportive FX, and organic growth. 3I Group gained 3.2 percent after Morgan Stanley raised the private equity group to "overweight", saying the value proposition of Benelux-based discount retailer Action, an important part of 3I's portfolio, is not fully priced in to the shares. Norsk Hydro led basic resource stocks higher, up 2.7 percent after ratings agency Moody's upgraded its baseline credit assessment of the aluminium producer to Baa2 from Baa3. German online classified ads firm Scout24 was the worst-performing European stock, down 7.1 percent and set for its worst day in 3 1/2 months after it posted results and a 2017 outlook below consensus. "There seems to have been a good deal of introspection and reflection at Scout ... 2H16 may not be much better than 1H16, but 2017 will be intriguing," say Jefferies analysts. Swedish bank SEB was down 5.3 percent after going ex-dividend.   Home U.K. News Sports U.S. Showbiz Australia Femail Health Science Money Video Travel Columnists Wires Home My Profile Logout Login Feedback DailyMail NEW ARTICLESHomeTop Share show ad European shares inch higher as Brexit divorce process to begin By Reuters Published: 05:28 EDT, 29 March 2017 | Updated: 05:28 EDT, 29 March 2017 e-mail By Helen Reid LONDON, March 29 (Reuters) - European shares edged higher on Wednesday as Britain was set to formally trigger divorce proceedings with the European Union it joined in 1973. The pan-European STOXX 600 index was 0.1 percent higher by 1000 GMT, with modest gains driven by broker upgrades and results. Markets were muted as investors awaited details on the two parties' negotiating positions ahead of long and complex talks. "It's like a race: we are firing the starting gun and now we just have to see how it develops," said Stephen Macklow-Smith, head of European equity strategy at JP Morgan Asset Management. "When you have a market that's more driven by macro than fundamentals it can be tricky, but the playbook is well rehearsed. Everyone has already positioned for this," he said. Both Britain's FTSE 100 and the more domestically exposed mid caps were flat. "If the negotiations go well, domestic stocks could do a bit better," said Macklow-Smith, noting their devaluation after investors shifted away from domestic exposure since the Brexit referendum last June. Separately, merger negotiations between London Stock Exchange and Deutsche Boerse were halted after EU antitrust regulators blocked the proposed deal, as expected, saying the merger's size would have harmed competition. LSE shares gained 1.8 percent, while Deutsche Boerse was up 0.3 percent. Autos stocks were the best sectoral gainers, rising 0.5 percent. German carmaker Daimler drove gains after it said it expected record sales for its Mercedes-Benz cars for the first quarter. Automotive suppliers Faurecia and Valeo benefited from broker upgrades. Engie rose 2.9 percent to its highest in more than four months, the top French and European gainer, after JP Morgan upgraded its view on the gas and electricity supplier to overweight. Top-ranked JPM analyst Vincent Ayral said Engie had reached an inflection point, with the dilutive effects of the company's transformation plan more than compensated by restructuring gains, supportive FX, and organic growth. 3I Group gained 3.2 percent after Morgan Stanley raised the private equity group to "overweight", saying the value proposition of Benelux-based discount retailer Action, an important part of 3I's portfolio, is not fully priced in to the shares. Norsk Hydro led basic resource stocks higher, up 2.7 percent after ratings agency Moody's upgraded its baseline credit assessment of the aluminium producer to Baa2 from Baa3. German online classified ads firm Scout24 was the worst-performing European stock, down 7.1 percent and set for its worst day in 3 1/2 months after it posted results and a 2017 outlook below consensus. "There seems to have been a good deal of introspection and reflection at Scout ... 2H16 may not be much better than 1H16, but 2017 will be intriguing," say Jefferies analysts. Swedish bank SEB was down 5.3 percent after going ex-dividend. (Reporting by Helen Reid; Editing by Kit Rees and Alison Williams) Share or comment on this article e-mail Sorry we are not currently accepting comments on this article. (LMNX) State Board of Administration of Florida Retirement System Has $794,000 Stake in PennyMac Mortgage Investment Trust (PMT) La Jolla Pharmaceutical Company (LJPC) Given “Buy” Rating at Jefferies Group LLC March 29th, 2017 - 0 comments - Filed Under - by Trevor Kearing Filed Under: Analyst Articles - US - Finance Tweet La Jolla Pharmaceutical Company (NASDAQ:LJPC)‘s stock had its “buy” rating reissued by investment analysts at Jefferies Group LLC in a report issued on Wednesday. They currently have a $40.00 target price on the biopharmaceutical company’s stock. Jefferies Group LLC’s target price would indicate a potential upside of 17.54% from the company’s previous close. LJPC has been the subject of several other research reports. Zacks Investment Research raised La Jolla Pharmaceutical Company from a “sell” rating to a “hold” rating in a report on Tuesday, January 17th. Chardan Capital reissued a “top pick” rating and issued a $75.00 price objective on shares of La Jolla Pharmaceutical Company in a report on Tuesday, January 24th. Cowen and Company reissued an “outperform” rating and issued a $55.00 price objective (up previously from $40.00) on shares of La Jolla Pharmaceutical Company in a report on Tuesday, February 28th. SunTrust Banks, Inc. reissued a “buy” rating and issued a $57.00 price objective (up previously from $38.00) on shares of La Jolla Pharmaceutical Company in a report on Monday, February 27th. Finally, JPMorgan Chase & Co. reissued a “buy” rating and issued a $40.00 price objective (up previously from $27.00) on shares of La Jolla Pharmaceutical Company in a report on Tuesday, February 28th. One analyst has rated the stock with a sell rating and six have assigned a buy rating to the stock. The stock currently has an average rating of “Buy” and an average price target of $46.86. Shares of La Jolla Pharmaceutical Company (NASDAQ:LJPC) opened at 34.03 on Wednesday. The company’s market capitalization is $621.42 million. La Jolla Pharmaceutical Company has a 1-year low of $14.24 and a 1-year high of $39.28. The stock has a 50 day moving average price of $28.81 and a 200 day moving average price of $22.32. La Jolla Pharmaceutical Company (NASDAQ:LJPC) last issued its quarterly earnings data on Thursday, February 23rd. The biopharmaceutical company reported ($1.44) earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, missing the Thomson Reuters’ consensus estimate of ($1.20) by $0.24. La Jolla Pharmaceutical Company had a negative net margin of 6,921.47% and a negative return on equity of 66.51%. On average, equities analysts anticipate that La Jolla Pharmaceutical Company will post ($5.02) EPS for the current fiscal year. About La Jolla Pharmaceutical Company La Jolla Pharmaceutical Company is a biopharmaceutical company. The Company is focused on the discovery, development and commercialization of therapies to improve outcomes in patients suffering from life-threatening diseases. It is engaged in the research, development and commercialization of its technologies and drug candidates for pharmaceutical products. About St. James's Place plc St. James’s Place plc is a United Kingdom-based company, which provides wealth management advice, investment management and related services to businesses and individuals across the United Kingdom. The Company’s segments include Life business, Unit Trust business, Distribution business and Other. The Company’s Life business segment offers pensions, protection and investment products through its life assurance subsidiaries. (MTD) Stake Increased by Dimensional Fund Advisors LP Dimensional Fund Advisors LP Has $36,226,000 Position in Howard Hughes Corp (HHC) LegacyTexas Financial Group Inc (LTXB) Forecasted to Earn Q2 2017 Earnings of $0.59 Per Share General Electric Company’s (GE) Hold Rating Reiterated at BMO Capital Markets March 29th, 2017 - 0 comments - Filed Under - by Stacy Sanders Filed Under: Analyst Articles - US - Finance Tweet BMO Capital Markets restated their hold rating on shares of General Electric Company (NYSE:GE) in a report issued on Thursday, StockTargetPrices.com reports. A number of other brokerages have also weighed in on GE. Zacks Investment Research lowered General Electric Company from a hold rating to a sell rating in a report on Tuesday, December 27th. Goldman Sachs Group Inc set a $31.00 price objective on General Electric Company and gave the company a neutral rating in a report on Monday, December 12th. Royal Bank of Canada reissued a buy rating and issued a $37.00 price objective on shares of General Electric Company in a report on Thursday, January 5th. JPMorgan Chase & Co. reissued an underweight rating and issued a $28.00 price objective on shares of General Electric Company in a report on Thursday, January 5th. Finally, Stifel Nicolaus set a $34.00 price objective on General Electric Company and gave the company a buy rating in a report on Thursday, December 8th. Two equities research analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, eight have assigned a hold rating, twelve have given a buy rating and one has given a strong buy rating to the company. The company currently has a consensus rating of Buy and an average price target of $33.24. General Electric Company (NYSE:GE) opened at 29.62 on Thursday. The company has a 50-day moving average price of $29.90 and a 200-day moving average price of $30.22. The stock has a market capitalization of $258.43 billion, a PE ratio of 33.17 and a beta of 1.20. General Electric Company has a 12-month low of $28.19 and a 12-month high of $33.00. General Electric Company (NYSE:GE) last released its quarterly earnings results on Friday, January 20th. The company reported $0.46 EPS for the quarter, meeting analysts’ consensus estimates of $0.46. General Electric Company had a return on equity of 15.99% and a net margin of 6.86%. The company earned $33.10 billion during the quarter, compared to analysts’ expectations of $33.67 billion. During the same period last year, the business posted $0.52 earnings per share. The firm’s revenue was down 2.4% compared to the same quarter last year. Analysts expect that General Electric Company will post $1.63 earnings per share for the current fiscal year. Toggle navigation Toggle navigation Home Samachar News Finance SPORTS Movies Bawarchi Astrology Videos Gold rates DUBAI GOLD RATES RUPEE Jobs Health Antzill Techtalk Web Sify Search Sify.com Finance Economy European shares inch higher as Brexit divorce process to begin European shares inch higher as Brexit divorce process to begin Source : Last Updated: Wed, Mar 29, 2017 15:00 hrs Tweet Mail Print * STOXX 600 up 0.1 pct * Gains muted as investors await Brexit details * Engie tops CAC 40; JPM analyst says 'at inflection point' * 3I up as Morgan Stanley praises Action value proposition * Autos stocks drive gains * EU antitrust regulators block LSE-Deutsche Boerse merger (ADVISORY- Follow European and UK stock markets in real time on the Reuters Live Markets blog on Eikon - see cpurl://apps.cp./cms/?pageId=livemarkets) By Helen Reid LONDON, March 29 (Reuters) - European shares edged higher on Wednesday as Britain was set to formally trigger divorce proceedings with the European Union it joined in 1973. The pan-European STOXX 600 index was 0.1 percent higher by 1000 GMT, with modest gains driven by broker upgrades and results. Markets were muted as investors awaited details on the two parties' negotiating positions ahead of long and complex talks. "It's like a race: we are firing the starting gun and now we just have to see how it develops," said Stephen Macklow-Smith, head of European equity strategy at JP Morgan Asset Management. "When you have a market that's more driven by macro than fundamentals it can be tricky, but the playbook is well rehearsed. Everyone has already positioned for this," he said. Both Britain's FTSE 100 and the more domestically exposed mid caps were flat. "If the negotiations go well, domestic stocks could do a bit better," said Macklow-Smith, noting their devaluation after investors shifted away from domestic exposure since the Brexit referendum last June. Separately, merger negotiations between London Stock Exchange and Deutsche Boerse were halted after EU antitrust regulators blocked the proposed deal, as expected, saying the merger's size would have harmed competition. LSE shares gained 1.8 percent, while Deutsche Boerse was up 0.3 percent. Autos stocks were the best sectoral gainers, rising 0.5 percent. German carmaker Daimler drove gains after it said it expected record sales for its Mercedes-Benz cars for the first quarter. Automotive suppliers Faurecia and Valeo benefited from broker upgrades. Engie rose 2.9 percent to its highest in more than four months, the top French and European gainer, after JP Morgan upgraded its view on the gas and electricity supplier to overweight. Top-ranked JPM analyst Vincent Ayral said Engie had reached an inflection point, with the dilutive effects of the company's transformation plan more than compensated by restructuring gains, supportive FX, and organic growth. 3I Group gained 3.2 percent after Morgan Stanley raised the private equity group to "overweight", saying the value proposition of Benelux-based discount retailer Action, an important part of 3I's portfolio, is not fully priced in to the shares. Norsk Hydro led basic resource stocks higher, up 2.7 percent after ratings agency Moody's upgraded its baseline credit assessment of the aluminium producer to Baa2 from Baa3. German online classified ads firm Scout24 was the worst-performing European stock, down 7.1 percent and set for its worst day in 3 1/2 months after it posted results and a 2017 outlook below consensus. "There seems to have been a good deal of introspection and reflection at Scout ... 2H16 may not be much better than 1H16, but 2017 will be intriguing," say Jefferies analysts. Swedish bank SEB was down 5.3 percent after going ex-dividend. The firm presently has a “sector performer” rating on the stock. Royal Bank of Canada’s price objective would suggest a potential upside of 4.66% from the stock’s current price. Other analysts have also recently issued research reports about the stock. Deutsche Bank AG upgraded shares of Aggreko plc to a “buy” rating and increased their price target for the stock from GBX 780 ($9.80) to GBX 1,000 ($12.57) in a research note on Thursday, December 15th. HSBC Holdings plc increased their price target on shares of Aggreko plc from GBX 735 ($9.24) to GBX 940 ($11.81) and gave the stock a “hold” rating in a research note on Wednesday, March 1st. Berenberg Bank reiterated a “hold” rating and set a GBX 815 ($10.24) price target on shares of Aggreko plc in a research note on Thursday, February 9th. Jefferies Group LLC reiterated a “hold” rating and set a GBX 750 ($9.43) price target on shares of Aggreko plc in a research note on Thursday, December 1st. Finally, JPMorgan Chase & Co. cut their price objective on shares of Aggreko plc from GBX 991 ($12.45) to GBX 905 ($11.37) and set a “neutral” rating for the company in a research report on Thursday, December 1st. Three investment analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, seven have issued a hold rating and two have assigned a buy rating to the company’s stock. Aggreko plc currently has a consensus rating of “Hold” and an average price target of GBX 888.45 ($11.17). Aggreko plc (LON:AGK) opened at 872.00 on Wednesday. The firm’s market capitalization is GBX 2.21 billion. Aggreko plc has a 52-week low of GBX 751.00 and a 52-week high of GBX 1,305.00. The company’s 50-day moving average is GBX 974.86 and its 200-day moving average is GBX 927.99. The company also recently disclosed a dividend, which will be paid on Wednesday, May 24th. Shareholders of record on Thursday, April 20th will be given a dividend of GBX 17.74 ($0.22) per share. The ex-dividend date is Thursday, April 20th. This represents a yield of 1.93%. This is an increase from Aggreko plc’s previous dividend of $9.38. COPYRIGHT VIOLATION WARNING: This news story was originally published by Daily Political and is owned by of Daily Political. The stock was bought at an average price of GBX 899 ($11.30) per share, for a total transaction of £8,990 ($11,298.23). Aggreko plc Company Profile Aggreko plc is a United Kingdom-based provider of modular, mobile power and related solutions. The Company’s segments include Power Solutions and Rental Solutions. The Power Solutions segment provides solutions for power requirements. The Power Solutions segment has two divisions: utility and industrial. Forecasts (WRE) March 29th, 2017 - 0 comments - Filed Under - by Stacy Sanders Filed Under: Analyst Articles - Estimates - Finance Tweet Washington Real Estate Investment Trust (NYSE:WRE) – Equities research analysts at Capital One Financial Corp. lifted their Q2 2017 EPS estimates for shares of Washington Real Estate Investment Trust in a research note issued on Thursday. Capital One Financial Corp. analyst C. Lucas now anticipates that the firm will earn $0.46 per share for the quarter, up from their previous forecast of $0.45. Capital One Financial Corp. also issued estimates for Washington Real Estate Investment Trust’s Q3 2017 earnings at $0.46 EPS, FY2017 earnings at $1.80 EPS and FY2018 earnings at $1.87 EPS. Washington Real Estate Investment Trust (NYSE:WRE) last announced its earnings results on Thursday, February 16th. The real estate investment trust reported $0.43 earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, missing the consensus estimate of $0.44 by $0.01. The business had revenue of $76.90 million for the quarter, compared to analysts’ expectations of $77.56 million. Washington Real Estate Investment Trust had a net margin of 55.81% and a return on equity of 19.15%. The firm’s quarterly revenue was down 2.8% compared to the same quarter last year. During the same quarter in the prior year, the company posted $0.46 earnings per share. Wells Fargo & Co reaffirmed a “hold” rating and issued a $32.00 price objective on shares of Washington Real Estate Investment Trust in a report on Thursday, December 1st. Finally, Raymond James Financial, Inc. raised shares of Washington Real Estate Investment Trust from a “market perform” rating to an “outperform” rating and set a $35.50 price objective for the company in a report on Monday, January 9th. Five analysts have rated the stock with a hold rating and two have given a buy rating to the company’s stock. Washington Real Estate Investment Trust presently has a consensus rating of “Hold” and a consensus target price of $34.08. Shares of Washington Real Estate Investment Trust (NYSE:WRE) opened at 30.71 on Monday. The stock has a market capitalization of $2.29 billion, a PE ratio of 18.62 and a beta of 0.89. Washington Real Estate Investment Trust has a 12 month low of $27.65 and a 12 month high of $34.61. The stock’s 50 day moving average is $31.81 and its 200 day moving average is $31.18. The company also recently disclosed a quarterly dividend, which will be paid on Friday, March 31st. Shareholders of record on Wednesday, March 15th will be issued a $0.30 dividend. The ex-dividend date of this dividend is Monday, March 13th. This represents a $1.20 dividend on an annualized basis and a yield of 3.91%. Washington Real Estate Investment Trust’s payout ratio is 48.98%. Washington Real Estate Investment Trust Company Profile Washington Real Estate Investment Trust is a self-administered equity real estate investment trust. The Company’s business consists of the ownership and operation of real property in the greater Washington metro region. The Company owns a diversified portfolio of office buildings, multifamily buildings and retail centers. Skip to content MilTech PR Distribution Menu HOME Add the press release Our team & Contact Posted on 29 March 2017 by Military News Noteworthy Tuesday Option Activity: RHT, JPM, CVX Shutterstock photo Looking at options trading activity among components of the S&P 500 index, there is noteworthy activity today in Red Hat Inc (Symbol: RHT), where a total volume of 22,473 contracts has been traded thus far today, a contract volume which is representative of approximately 2.2 million underlying shares (given that every 1 contract represents 100 underlying shares). That number works out to 121.7% of RHT’s average daily trading volume over the past month, of 1.8 million shares. Especially high volume was seen for the $90 strike call option expiring April 21, 2017 , with 5,154 contracts trading so far today, representing approximately 515,400 underlying shares of RHT. Below is a chart showing RHT’s trailing twelve month trading history, with the $90 strike highlighted in orange: JPMorgan Chase & Co (Symbol: JPM) saw options trading volume of 69,708 contracts, representing approximately 7.0 million underlying shares or approximately 42% of JPM’s average daily trading volume over the past month, of 16.6 million shares. Particularly high volume was seen for the $90 strike call option expiring January 19, 2018 , with 13,034 contracts trading so far today, representing approximately 1.3 million underlying shares of JPM. Below is a chart showing JPM’s trailing twelve month trading history, with the $90 strike highlighted in orange: And Chevron Corporation (Symbol: CVX) saw options trading volume of 30,705 contracts, representing approximately 3.1 million underlying shares or approximately 41.6% of CVX’s average daily trading volume over the past month, of 7.4 million shares. Particularly high volume was seen for the $105 strike put option expiring April 21, 2017 , with 4,106 contracts trading so far today, representing approximately 410,600 underlying shares of CVX. Below is a chart showing CVX’s trailing twelve month trading history, with the $105 strike highlighted in orange: For the various different available expirations for RHT options , JPM options , or CVX options , visit StockOptionsChannel.com. Liberum Capital reaffirmed a hold rating and set a GBX 325 ($4.08) price objective on shares of Moneysupermarket.Com Group PLC in a research report on Tuesday, February 28th. The ex-dividend date of this dividend is Thursday, April 6th. This represents a yield of 2.15%. This is an increase from Moneysupermarket.Com Group PLC’s previous dividend of $2.75. In related news, insider Peter Plumb sold 444,580 shares of Moneysupermarket.Com Group PLC stock in a transaction on Wednesday, March 8th. The shares were sold at an average price of GBX 341 ($4.29), for a total value of £1,516,017.80 ($1,905,263.04). Moneysupermarket.Com Group PLC Company Profile Moneysupermarket.com Group PLC provides services, tools and products for customers, through its brands, MoneySuperMarket, MoneySavingExpert and TravelSupermarket. The Company operates in five segments: Money, which offers customers the ability to search for and compare products, including credit cards, current accounts, mortgages, loans, savings accounts and business finance; Insurance, which offers customers the ability to search for and compare insurance products, such as breakdown, dental, home, life, medical, motor, pet and travel insurance; Home Services, which offers customers the ability to search for and compare products, such as broadband, mobile phones, vouchers, shopping and utilities; Travel, which operates under the brand name TravelSupermarket.com, and MoneySavingExpert.com., which is a consumer Website and is dedicated to cutting bills for customers. Infineon Technologies AG Company Profile Infineon Technologies AG is a Germany-based company developing semiconductors and system solutions for automotive and industrial electronics, and chip card, as well as security applications. It diversifies its operations into four main divisions: Automotive; Industrial Power Control; Chip card & Security, and Power Management and Multimarket. (NYSE:SAN) from a hold rating to a buy rating in a research report released on Thursday. Zacks Investment Research currently has $6.75 target price on the stock. According to Zacks, “Banco Santander SA is the biggest bank in Spain and the biggest international bank in Latin America as well. The Bank concentrates its activities in Andalucia, Castilla-Leon, Catalonia, Madrid, Valencia and Cantabria. The Bank provides banking services for individuals and companies, leasing, factoring, stockbrokerage and mutual fund services. “ Other equities research analysts have also issued reports about the stock. The firm has a market capitalization of $2.32 billion and a price-to-earnings ratio of 9.76. Cooper Tire & Rubber Co has a 1-year low of $29.29 and a 1-year high of $44.12. The stock has a 50 day moving average price of $40.69 and a 200 day moving average price of $38.03. Cooper Tire & Rubber Co (NYSE:CTB) last announced its quarterly earnings data on Friday, February 17th. The company reported $1.28 earnings per share for the quarter, beating the Thomson Reuters’ consensus estimate of $0.94 by $0.34. The business earned $783.89 million during the quarter, compared to analyst estimates of $767.36 million. Cooper Tire & Rubber Co had a return on equity of 23.13% and a net margin of 8.17%. The company’s revenue was up 1.1% on a year-over-year basis. During the same quarter in the prior year, the firm posted $1.04 earnings per share. Analysts predict that Cooper Tire & Rubber Co will post $3.78 EPS for the current year. If you are accessing this story on another publication, it was illegally copied and reposted in violation of U.S. & international trademark and copyright laws. The business also recently announced a quarterly dividend, which will be paid on Friday, March 31st. Stockholders of record on Thursday, March 2nd will be given a dividend of $0.105 per share. This represents a $0.42 dividend on an annualized basis and a dividend yield of 0.95%. The ex-dividend date is Tuesday, February 28th. Cooper Tire & Rubber Co’s dividend payout ratio (DPR) is presently 9.86%. In other news, VP Stephen Zamansky sold 14,041 shares of the business’s stock in a transaction on Tuesday, February 28th. The stock was sold at an average price of $40.37, for a total transaction of $566,835.17. The sale was disclosed in a document filed with the SEC, which is available through the SEC website. 0.80% of the stock is owned by insiders. Large investors have recently made changes to their positions in the company. BNP Paribas Arbitrage SA raised its position in Cooper Tire & Rubber Co by 43.6% in the third quarter. BNP Paribas Arbitrage SA now owns 6,430 shares of the company’s stock valued at $244,000 after buying an additional 1,953 shares during the last quarter. Advisory Services Network LLC raised its position in Cooper Tire & Rubber Co by 0.3% in the third quarter. Advisory Services Network LLC now owns 7,010 shares of the company’s stock valued at $267,000 after buying an additional 23 shares during the last quarter. Alpha Windward LLC acquired a new position in Cooper Tire & Rubber Co during the third quarter valued at $488,000. 1st Global Advisors Inc. acquired a new position in Cooper Tire & Rubber Co during the third quarter valued at $680,000. Finally, Horrell Capital Management Inc. raised its position in Cooper Tire & Rubber Co by 0.5% in the third quarter. Horrell Capital Management Inc. now owns 26,990 shares of the company’s stock valued at $1,026,000 after buying an additional 128 shares during the last quarter. 90.09% of the stock is currently owned by institutional investors. Cooper Tire & Rubber Co Company Profile Cooper Tire & Rubber Company is a manufacturer and marketer of replacement tires. The Company specializes in the design, manufacture, marketing and sales of passenger car, light truck, medium truck, motorcycle, and racing tires. The Company operates through four segments: North America, Latin America, Europe, and Asia. Primero Mining Corp (P) Rating Reiterated by Scotiabank NEXT plc (NXT) Receives Hold Rating from Peel Hunt March 28th, 2017 - 0 comments - Filed Under - by Stacy Sanders Filed Under: Analyst Articles - UK - Finance Tweet Peel Hunt reiterated their hold rating on shares of NEXT plc (LON:NXT) in a report published on Thursday. They currently have a GBX 4,200 ($52.78) target price on the stock. NXT has been the topic of a number of other reports. Deutsche Bank AG reiterated a buy rating and issued a GBX 5,950 ($74.78) price objective on shares of NEXT plc in a research report on Tuesday, December 20th. HSBC Holdings plc lowered NEXT plc to a reduce rating and decreased their price objective for the company from GBX 4,680 ($58.82) to GBX 3,530 ($44.36) in a research report on Thursday, January 5th. Redburn Partners upgraded NEXT plc to a buy rating in a research report on Wednesday, March 1st. Haitong Bank reiterated a buy rating and issued a GBX 5,900 ($74.15) price objective on shares of NEXT plc in a research report on Tuesday, January 3rd. Finally, JPMorgan Chase & Co. decreased their price objective on NEXT plc from GBX 5,480 ($68.87) to GBX 4,580 ($57.56) and set a neutral rating on the stock in a research report on Thursday, January 5th. Five equities research analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, fourteen have given a hold rating and four have issued a buy rating to the stock. The company currently has a consensus rating of Hold and a consensus target price of GBX 4,687.52 ($58.91). NEXT plc (LON:NXT) opened at 4289.00 on Thursday. NEXT plc has a 52-week low of GBX 3,550.00 and a 52-week high of GBX 5,705.00. The firm’s market capitalization is GBX 6.13 billion. The company’s 50-day moving average price is GBX 3,929.92 and its 200 day moving average price is GBX 4,499.37. About NEXT plc NEXT plc is a United Kingdom-based retailer offering clothing, footwear, accessories and home products. The Company’s segments include NEXT Retail, a chain of over 500 stores in the United Kingdom and Eire; NEXT Directory, an online and catalogue shopping business with over four million active customers and international Websites serving approximately 70 countries; NEXT International Retail, with approximately 200 mainly franchised stores; NEXT Sourcing, which designs and sources NEXT branded products; Lipsy, which designs and sells Lipsy branded younger women’s fashion products, and Property Management, which holds properties and property leases which are sub-let to other segments and external parties. Weather Your 4-day local weather forecast Thursday March 30, 2017 News Business Larger / SmallerNight Mode Banks lift ASX to a new high Patrick Commins and Jens Meyer 29 Mar 2017, 5:05 p.m. The local sharemarket extended Tuesday's strong gains to hit another near two-year high, with banks once again at the vanguard of the rally. Banks lift ASX to a new high Tweet Facebook of ╳ exit The local sharemarket extended Tuesday's strong gains to hit another near two-year high, with banks once again at the vanguard of the rally. The S&P/ASX 200 Index climbed a further 52 points, or 0.9 per cent, to 5874 points, its highest since May 2015, bringing gains in the benchmark measure over the past two days to 127 points, or 2.2 per cent. Wednesday's sharemarket rise was widely spread, with around three in four of the top 200 names closing higher, and all sectors in the green. But most of the day's upwards impetus was from investors piling into the major lenders for the second session in a row, as investors were buoyed by analysis suggesting the recent wave of mortgage rate rises will flow through to higher earnings. Commonwealth Bank of Australia added 1 per cent, National Australia Bank ,1.2 per cent, ANZ Banking Group, 1.1 per cent and Westpac Banking Corp up 1.3 per cent. Macquarie Group also climbed 1.3 per cent. In corporate news, veteran retailer Solomon Lew confirmed he acquired a 10.8 per cent stake in Myer through his listed investment company, Premier Investments, which also informed the market it did not "currently intend" to make a bid for the department store. Fairfax Media shares jumped 2.8 per cent amid increasing talk of a private equity takeover offer. After wobbling last week amid fears of an end to the "Trump trade" rally that has followed the US election, the ASX 200 has recouped all those losses and pushed to new heights. In addition to improving sentiment around the heavyweight ASX-listed lenders, stocks have also been buoyed by "the realisation that actually the world is getting better, and it's not all about Donald Trump," JP Morgan Asset Management global market strategist Kerry Craig said. This renewed optimism in the drivers of the post-US election rally helped push commodity prices and miners higher on Wednesday. BHP Billiton and Fortescue Metals added 0.3 per cent, while Rio Tinto added 0.7 per cent. Energy names were well supported as the recent slide in oil prices looks to have been arrested. Woodside Petroleum climbed 1 per cent. Earnings expectations for the Australian sharemarket have climbed by 20 per cent since the middle of 2016, IG chief markets strategist Chris Weston said. "The market is pricey, but not at a level where the fund managers really start getting hot under the collar, going to cash or looking at hedging structures," Mr Weston said. "But the key question from here is what is going to propel earnings higher, given a lot of the [earnings per share] revisions have come from higher oil, bulk [commodities] and base metals [prices]." Expected profit growth outside mining and more recently banking is more subdued, Mr Kerry agreed. "I think you are getting a very positive view at the index level in terms of what the market is going to deliver in earnings, but it's very focused [on a sector level] in where it will come through," Mr Kerry agreed. "I don't know how many investors appreciate that." "This commodities windfall has been very slow to feed through to the rest of the economy and the rest of the market," he said. Stock of the day - Cooper Energy Oil and gas developer Cooper Energy has launched a $151 million equity raising to help fund its new Sole offshore gas project in Victoria's Gippsland Basin. The Sole gas project is expected to cost $355 million, and Cooper says the the project will increase the company's proven and probable reserves by 43 million barrels of oil equivalent (mmboe) from the 11.6 mmboe held at the start of the year. The stock was put in a trading halt for the duration of the institutional portion of the equity raising, with 150 million new shares issued to raise $47 million. The shares are valued at 31.5??, a discount on the 38.5?? at which Cooper last traded. All three analysts following the company have a 'buy' rating on the stock, with an average price target of 60??. Market movers Sterling jitters The pound was on the skids after British Prime Minister Theresa May signed a letter to formally start the country's exit from the European Union. The pound fell another 0.6 per cent against the greenback to $US1.2377 on Wednesday after sliding 0.9 per cent overnight. The Aussie in turn gained 0.5 per cent to 61.62 pence, following a 1.1 per cent overnight rally. Traders said that investors still nervous about the exit process were the likely sellers. Global trade More signs pointing to a pick-up in global growth: world trade is recovering, despite worries about rising protectionism. Trade volumes increased by 2.9 per cent in January in three-month average year-on-year terms, which compares favourably to annual growth of 1.3 per cent in 2016 as a whole. The upbeat figures chime with alternative measures of world trade, such as an up-tick in both the volume of containers shipped through major ports and the volume of air freight in January. Iron ore Steel and iron ore futures in China on Wednesday pulled away from multi-week lows, but traders predict further price declines as supply outpaces demand in the world's top market. Iron ore for September delivery on the Dalian Commodity Exchange was up 2.6 per cent. Prospective buyers of iron ore in China are holding back following the recent price slide that took spot prices of the steelmaking raw material to a seven-week trough of $81.57 a tonne on Monday. "Every time the price starts to drop, buying interest would shrink," said a Shanghai-based iron ore trader. Australian dollar The Aussie edged higher on Tuesday to US76.4?? in late trade, and CBA chief currency strategist Richard Grace said to keep an eye on US politics for an indication of where the Aussie dollar is headed. "The biggest single determinant for the Australian dollar's direction over the next months will be what Trump does on tax," Mr Grace said. Any signs that Trump will secure the significant tax cuts he's flagged will deliver a boost to the greenback, he said. The story Banks lift ASX to a new high first appeared on The Sydney Morning Herald.
